  59class ThermoBaseClass:
  60    """Class for parsing Thermo Raw files and extracting information from them.
  61
  62    Parameters:
  63    -----------
  64    file_location : str or pathlib.Path or s3path.S3Path
  65        Thermo Raw file path or S3 path.
  66
  67    Attributes:
  68    -----------
  69    file_path : str or pathlib.Path or s3path.S3Path
  70        The file path of the Thermo Raw file.
  71    parameters : LCMSParameters
  72        The LCMS parameters for the Thermo Raw file.
  73    chromatogram_settings : LiquidChromatographSetting
  74        The chromatogram settings for the Thermo Raw file.
  75    scans : list or tuple
  76        The selected scans for the Thermo Raw file.
  77    start_scan : int
  78        The starting scan number for the Thermo Raw file.
  79    end_scan : int
  80        The ending scan number for the Thermo Raw file.
  81
  82    Methods:
  83    --------
  84    * set_msordertype(scanFilter, mstype: str = 'ms1') -> scanFilter
  85        Convert the user-passed MS Type string to a Thermo MSOrderType object.
  86    * get_creation_time() -> datetime.datetime
  87        Extract the creation date stamp from the .RAW file and return it as a formatted datetime object.
  88    * remove_temp_file()
  89        Remove the temporary file if the path is from S3Path.
  90    * get_polarity_mode(scan_number: int) -> int
  91        Get the polarity mode for the given scan number.
  92    * get_filter_for_scan_num(scan_number: int) -> List[str]
  93        Get the filter for the given scan number.
  94    * check_full_scan(scan_number: int) -> bool
  95        Check if the given scan number is a full scan.
  96    * get_all_filters() -> Tuple[Dict[int, str], List[str]]
  97        Get all scan filters for the Thermo Raw file.
  98    * get_scan_header(scan: int) -> Dict[str, Any]
  99        Get the full dictionary of scan header metadata for the given scan number.
 100    * get_rt_time_from_trace(trace) -> Tuple[List[float], List[float], List[int]]
 101        Get the retention time, intensity, and scan number from the given trace.
 102    * get_eics(target_mzs: List[float], tic_data: Dict[str, Any], ms_type: str = 'MS !d',
 103             peak_detection: bool = True, smooth: bool = True, plot: bool = False,
 104             ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes.Axes] = None, legend: bool = False) -> Tuple[Dict[float, EIC_Data], matplotlib.axes.Axes]
 105        Get the extracted ion chromatograms (EICs) for the target m/z values.
 106
 107    """
 108
 109    def __init__(self, file_location):
 110        """file_location: srt pathlib.Path or s3path.S3Path
 111        Thermo Raw file path
 112        """
 113        # Thread.__init__(self)
 114        if isinstance(file_location, str):
 115            file_path = Path(file_location)
 116
 117        elif isinstance(file_location, S3Path):
 118            temp_dir = Path("tmp/")
 119            temp_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
 120
 121            file_path = temp_dir / file_location.name
 122            with open(file_path, "wb") as fh:
 123                fh.write(file_location.read_bytes())
 124
 125        else:
 126            file_path = file_location
 127
 128        self.iRawDataPlus = RawFileReaderAdapter.FileFactory(str(file_path))
 129
 130        if not self.iRawDataPlus.IsOpen:
 131            raise FileNotFoundError(
 132                "Unable to access the RAW file using the RawFileReader class!"
 133            )
 134
 135        # Check for any errors in the RAW file
 136        if self.iRawDataPlus.IsError:
 137            raise IOError(
 138                "Error opening ({}) - {}".format(self.iRawDataPlus.FileError, file_path)
 139            )
 140
 141        self.res = self.iRawDataPlus.SelectInstrument(Device.MS, 1)
 142
 143        self.file_path = file_location
 144        self.iFileHeader = FileHeaderReaderFactory.ReadFile(str(file_path))
 145
 146        # removing tmp file
 147
 148        self._init_settings()
 149
 150    def _init_settings(self):
 151        """
 152        Initialize the LCMSParameters object.
 153        """
 154        self._parameters = LCMSParameters()
 155
 156    @property
 157    def parameters(self) -> LCMSParameters:
 158        """
 159        Get or set the LCMSParameters object.
 160        """
 161        return self._parameters
 162
 163    @parameters.setter
 164    def parameters(self, instance_LCMSParameters: LCMSParameters):
 165        self._parameters = instance_LCMSParameters

 167    @property
 168    def chromatogram_settings(self) -> LiquidChromatographSetting:
 169        """
 170        Get or set the LiquidChromatographSetting object.
 171        """
 172        return self.parameters.lc_ms
 173
 174    @chromatogram_settings.setter
 175    def chromatogram_settings(
 176        self, instance_LiquidChromatographSetting: LiquidChromatographSetting
 177    ):
 178        self.parameters.lc_ms = instance_LiquidChromatographSetting

 180    @property
 181    def scans(self) -> list | tuple:
 182        """scans : list or tuple
 183        If list uses Thermo AverageScansInScanRange for selected scans, ortherwise uses Thermo AverageScans for a scan range
 184        """
 185        return self.chromatogram_settings.scans
 186
 187    @property
 188    def start_scan(self) -> int:
 189        """
 190        Get the starting scan number for the Thermo Raw file.
 191        """
 192        if self.scans[0] == -1:
 193            return self.iRawDataPlus.RunHeaderEx.FirstSpectrum
 194        else:
 195            return self.scans[0]
 196
 197    @property
 198    def end_scan(self) -> int:
 199        """
 200        Get the ending scan number for the Thermo Raw file.
 201        """
 202        if self.scans[-1] == -1:
 203            return self.iRawDataPlus.RunHeaderEx.LastSpectrum
 204        else:
 205            return self.scans[-1]
 206
 207    def set_msordertype(self, scanFilter, mstype: str = "ms1"):
 208        """
 209        Function to convert user passed string MS Type to Thermo MSOrderType object
 210        Limited to MS1 through MS10.
 211
 212        Parameters:
 213        -----------
 214        scanFilter : Thermo.ScanFilter
 215            The scan filter object.
 216        mstype : str, optional
 217            The MS Type string, by default 'ms1'
 218
 219        """
 220        mstype = mstype.upper()
 221        # Check that a valid mstype is passed
 222        if (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) > 10) or (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) < 1):
 223            warn("MS Type not valid, must be between MS1 and MS10")
 224
 225        msordertypedict = {
 226            "MS1": MSOrderType.Ms,
 227            "MS2": MSOrderType.Ms2,
 228            "MS3": MSOrderType.Ms3,
 229            "MS4": MSOrderType.Ms4,
 230            "MS5": MSOrderType.Ms5,
 231            "MS6": MSOrderType.Ms6,
 232            "MS7": MSOrderType.Ms7,
 233            "MS8": MSOrderType.Ms8,
 234            "MS9": MSOrderType.Ms9,
 235            "MS10": MSOrderType.Ms10,
 236        }
 237        scanFilter.MSOrder = msordertypedict[mstype]
 238        return scanFilter
 239
 240    def get_creation_time(self) -> datetime.datetime:
 241        """
 242        Extract the creation date stamp from the .RAW file
 243        Return formatted creation date stamp.
 244
 245        """
 246        credate = self.iRawDataPlus.CreationDate.get_Ticks()
 247        credate = datetime.datetime(1, 1, 1) + datetime.timedelta(
 248            microseconds=credate / 10
 249        )
 250        return credate
 251
 252    def remove_temp_file(self) -> None:
 253        """if the path is from S3Path data cannot be serialized to io.ByteStream and
 254        a temporary copy is stored at the temp dir
 255        use this function only at the end of your execution scrip
 256        some LCMS class methods depend on this file
 257        """
 258
 259        self.file_path.unlink()
 260
 261    def get_polarity_mode(self, scan_number: int) -> int:
 262        """
 263        Get the polarity mode for the given scan number.
 264
 265        Parameters:
 266        -----------
 267        scan_number : int
 268            The scan number.
 269
 270        Raises:
 271        -------
 272        Exception
 273            If the polarity mode is unknown.
 274
 275        """
 276        polarity_symbol = self.get_filter_for_scan_num(scan_number)[1]
 277
 278        if polarity_symbol == "+":
 279            return 1
 280            # return 'POSITIVE_ION_MODE'
 281
 282        elif polarity_symbol == "-":
 283            return -1
 284
 285        else:
 286            raise Exception("Polarity Mode Unknown, please set it manually")
 287
 288    def get_filter_for_scan_num(self, scan_number: int) -> List[str]:
 289        """
 290        Returns the closest matching run time that corresponds to scan_number for the current
 291        controller. This function is only supported for MS device controllers.
 292        e.g.  ['FTMS', '-', 'p', 'NSI', 'Full', 'ms', '[200.00-1000.00]']
 293
 294        Parameters:
 295        -----------
 296        scan_number : int
 297            The scan number.
 298
 299        """
 300        scan_label = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanEventStringForScanNumber(scan_number)
 301
 302        return str(scan_label).split()
 303
 304    def check_full_scan(self, scan_number: int) -> bool:
 305        # scan_filter.ScanMode 0 = FULL
 306        scan_filter = self.iRawDataPlus.GetFilterForScanNumber(scan_number)
 307
 308        return scan_filter.ScanMode == MSOrderType.Ms
 309
 310    def get_all_filters(self) -> Tuple[Dict[int, str], List[str]]:
 311        """
 312        Get all scan filters.
 313        This function is only supported for MS device controllers.
 314        e.g.  ['FTMS', '-', 'p', 'NSI', 'Full', 'ms', '[200.00-1000.00]']
 315
 316        """
 317
 318        scanrange = range(self.start_scan, self.end_scan + 1)
 319        scanfiltersdic = {}
 320        scanfilterslist = []
 321        for scan_number in scanrange:
 322            scan_label = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanEventStringForScanNumber(scan_number)
 323            scanfiltersdic[scan_number] = scan_label
 324            scanfilterslist.append(scan_label)
 325        scanfilterset = list(set(scanfilterslist))
 326        return scanfiltersdic, scanfilterset
 327
 328    def get_scan_header(self, scan: int) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 329        """
 330        Get full dictionary of scan header meta data, i.e. AGC status, ion injection time, etc.
 331
 332        Parameters:
 333        -----------
 334        scan : int
 335            The scan number.
 336
 337        """
 338        header = self.iRawDataPlus.GetTrailerExtraInformation(scan)
 339
 340        header_dic = {}
 341        for i in range(header.Length):
 342            header_dic.update({header.Labels[i]: header.Values[i]})
 343        return header_dic
 344
 345    @staticmethod
 346    def get_rt_time_from_trace(trace) -> Tuple[List[float], List[float], List[int]]:
 347        """trace: ThermoFisher.CommonCore.Data.Business.ChromatogramSignal"""
 348        return list(trace.Times), list(trace.Intensities), list(trace.Scans)
 349
 350    def get_eics(
 351        self,
 352        target_mzs: List[float],
 353        tic_data: Dict[str, Any],
 354        ms_type="MS !d",
 355        peak_detection=True,
 356        smooth=True,
 357        plot=False,
 358        ax: Optional[axes.Axes] = None,
 359        legend=False,
 360    ) -> Tuple[Dict[float, EIC_Data], axes.Axes]:
 361        """ms_type: str ('MS', MS2')
 362        start_scan: int default -1 will select the lowest available
 363        end_scan: int default -1 will select the highest available
 364
 365        returns:
 366
 367            chroma: dict{target_mz: EIC_Data(
 368                                        Scans: [int]
 369                                            original thermo scan numbers
 370                                        Time: [floats]
 371                                            list of retention times
 372                                        TIC: [floats]
 373                                            total ion chromatogram
 374                                        Apexes: [int]
 375                                            original thermo apex scan number after peak picking
 376                                        )
 377
 378        """
 379
 380        options = MassOptions()
 381        options.ToleranceUnits = ToleranceUnits.ppm
 382        options.Tolerance = self.chromatogram_settings.eic_tolerance_ppm
 383
 384        all_chroma_settings = []
 385
 386        for target_mz in target_mzs:
 387            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.MassRange)
 388            settings.Filter = ms_type
 389            settings.MassRanges = [Range(target_mz, target_mz)]
 390
 391            chroma_settings = IChromatogramSettings(settings)
 392
 393            all_chroma_settings.append(chroma_settings)
 394
 395        # chroma_settings2 = IChromatogramSettings(settings)
 396        # print(chroma_settings.FragmentMass)
 397        # print(chroma_settings.FragmentMass)
 398        # print(chroma_settings)
 399        # print(chroma_settings)
 400
 401        data = self.iRawDataPlus.GetChromatogramData(
 402            all_chroma_settings, self.start_scan, self.end_scan, options
 403        )
 404
 405        traces = ChromatogramSignal.FromChromatogramData(data)
 406
 407        chroma = {}
 408
 409        if plot:
 410            from matplotlib.transforms import Bbox
 411            import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 412
 413            if not ax:
 414                # ax = plt.gca()
 415                # ax.clear()
 416                fig, ax = plt.subplots()
 417
 418            else:
 419                fig = plt.gcf()
 420
 421            # plt.show()
 422
 423        for i, trace in enumerate(traces):
 424            if trace.Length > 0:
 425                rt, eic, scans = self.get_rt_time_from_trace(trace)
 426                if smooth:
 427                    eic = self.smooth_tic(eic)
 428
 429                chroma[target_mzs[i]] = EIC_Data(scans=scans, time=rt, eic=eic)
 430                if plot:
 431                    ax.plot(rt, eic, label="{:.5f}".format(target_mzs[i]))
 432
 433        if peak_detection:
 434            # max_eic = self.get_max_eic(chroma)
 435            max_signal = max(tic_data.tic)
 436
 437            for eic_data in chroma.values():
 438                eic = eic_data.eic
 439                time = eic_data.time
 440
 441                if len(eic) != len(tic_data.tic):
 442                    warn(
 443                        "The software assumes same lenth of TIC and EIC, this does not seems to be the case and the results mass spectrum selected by the scan number might not be correct"
 444                    )
 445
 446                if eic.max() > 0:
 447                    centroid_eics = self.eic_centroid_detector(time, eic, max_signal)
 448                    eic_data.apexes = [i for i in centroid_eics]
 449
 450                    if plot:
 451                        for peak_indexes in eic_data.apexes:
 452                            apex_index = peak_indexes[1]
 453                            ax.plot(
 454                                time[apex_index],
 455                                eic[apex_index],
 456                                marker="x",
 457                                linewidth=0,
 458                            )
 459
 460        if plot:
 461            ax.set_xlabel("Time (min)")
 462            ax.set_ylabel("a.u.")
 463            ax.set_title(ms_type + " EIC")
 464            ax.tick_params(axis="both", which="major", labelsize=12)
 465            ax.axes.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
 466            ax.axes.spines["right"].set_visible(False)
 467
 468            if legend:
 469                legend = ax.legend(loc="upper left", bbox_to_anchor=(1.02, 0, 0.07, 1))
 470                fig.subplots_adjust(right=0.76)
 471                # ax.set_prop_cycle(color=plt.cm.gist_rainbow(np.linspace(0, 1, len(traces))))
 472
 473                d = {"down": 30, "up": -30}
 474
 475                def func(evt):
 476                    if legend.contains(evt):
 477                        bbox = legend.get_bbox_to_anchor()
 478                        bbox = Bbox.from_bounds(
 479                            bbox.x0, bbox.y0 + d[evt.button], bbox.width, bbox.height
 480                        )
 481                        tr = legend.axes.transAxes.inverted()
 482                        legend.set_bbox_to_anchor(bbox.transformed(tr))
 483                        fig.canvas.draw_idle()
 484
 485                fig.canvas.mpl_connect("scroll_event", func)
 486            return chroma, ax
 487        else:
 488            return chroma, None
 489            rt = []
 490            tic = []
 491            scans = []
 492            for i in range(traces[0].Length):
 493                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
 494
 495                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
 496                rt.append(traces[0].Times[i])
 497                tic.append(traces[0].Intensities[i])
 498                scans.append(traces[0].Scans[i])
 499
 500            return traces
 501            # plot_chroma(rt, tic)
 502            # plt.show()
 503
 504    def get_tic(
 505        self,
 506        ms_type="MS !d",
 507        peak_detection=True,
 508        smooth=True,
 509        plot=False,
 510        ax=None,
 511        trace_type="TIC",
 512    ) -> Tuple[TIC_Data, axes.Axes]:
 513        """ms_type: str ('MS !d', 'MS2', None)
 514            if you use None you get all scans.
 515        peak_detection: bool
 516        smooth: bool
 517        plot: bool
 518        ax: matplotlib axis object
 519        trace_type: str ('TIC','BPC')
 520
 521        returns:
 522            chroma: dict
 523            {
 524            Scan: [int]
 525                original thermo scan numberMS
 526            Time: [floats]
 527                list of retention times
 528            TIC: [floats]
 529                total ion chromatogram
 530            Apexes: [int]
 531                original thermo apex scan number after peak picking
 532            }
 533        """
 534        if trace_type == "TIC":
 535            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.TIC)
 536        elif trace_type == "BPC":
 537            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.BasePeak)
 538        else:
 539            raise ValueError(f"{trace_type} undefined")
 540        if ms_type == "all":
 541            settings.Filter = None
 542        else:
 543            settings.Filter = ms_type
 544
 545        chroma_settings = IChromatogramSettings(settings)
 546
 547        data = self.iRawDataPlus.GetChromatogramData(
 548            [chroma_settings], self.start_scan, self.end_scan
 549        )
 550
 551        trace = ChromatogramSignal.FromChromatogramData(data)
 552
 553        data = TIC_Data(time=[], scans=[], tic=[], bpc=[], apexes=[])
 554
 555        if trace[0].Length > 0:
 556            for i in range(trace[0].Length):
 557                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
 558
 559                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
 560                data.time.append(trace[0].Times[i])
 561                data.tic.append(trace[0].Intensities[i])
 562                data.scans.append(trace[0].Scans[i])
 563
 564                # print(trace[0].Scans[i])
 565            if smooth:
 566                data.tic = self.smooth_tic(data.tic)
 567
 568            else:
 569                data.tic = np.array(data.tic)
 570
 571            if peak_detection:
 572                centroid_peak_indexes = [
 573                    i for i in self.centroid_detector(data.time, data.tic)
 574                ]
 575
 576                data.apexes = centroid_peak_indexes
 577
 578            if plot:
 579                if not ax:
 580                    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 581
 582                    ax = plt.gca()
 583                    # fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 3))
 584
 585                ax.plot(data.time, data.tic, label=trace_type)
 586                ax.set_xlabel("Time (min)")
 587                ax.set_ylabel("a.u.")
 588                if peak_detection:
 589                    for peak_indexes in data.apexes:
 590                        apex_index = peak_indexes[1]
 591                        ax.plot(
 592                            data.time[apex_index],
 593                            data.tic[apex_index],
 594                            marker="x",
 595                            linewidth=0,
 596                        )
 597
 598                # plt.show()
 599                if trace_type == "BPC":
 600                    data.bpc = data.tic
 601                    data.tic = []
 602                return data, ax
 603            if trace_type == "BPC":
 604                data.bpc = data.tic
 605                data.tic = []
 606            return data, None
 607
 608        else:
 609            return None, None
 610
 611    def get_average_mass_spectrum(
 612        self,
 613        spectrum_mode: str = "profile",
 614        auto_process: bool = True,
 615        ppm_tolerance: float = 5.0,
 616        ms_type: str = "MS1",
 617    ) -> MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid:
 618        """
 619        Averages mass spectra over a scan range using Thermo's AverageScansInScanRange method
 620        or a scan list using Thermo's AverageScans method
 621        spectrum_mode: str
 622            centroid or profile mass spectrum
 623        auto_process: bool
 624            If true performs peak picking, and noise threshold calculation after creation of mass spectrum object
 625        ms_type: str
 626            String of form 'ms1' or 'ms2' or 'MS3' etc. Valid up to MS10.
 627            Internal function converts to Thermo MSOrderType class.
 628
 629        """
 630
 631        def get_profile_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict, auto_process: bool):
 632            mz_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Positions)
 633            abund_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Intensities)
 634
 635            data_dict = {
 636                Labels.mz: mz_list,
 637                Labels.abundance: abund_list,
 638            }
 639
 640            return MassSpecProfile(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process)
 641
 642        def get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict):
 643            noise = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Noises)
 644
 645            baselines = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Baselines)
 646
 647            rp = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Resolutions)
 648
 649            magnitude = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Intensities)
 650
 651            mz = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Masses)
 652
 653            array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
 654            l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
 655
 656            d_params["baseline_noise"] = np.average(array_noise_std)
 657
 658            d_params["baseline_noise_std"] = np.std(array_noise_std)
 659
 660            data_dict = {
 661                Labels.mz: mz,
 662                Labels.abundance: magnitude,
 663                Labels.rp: rp,
 664                Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
 665            }
 666
 667            mass_spec = MassSpecCentroid(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=False)
 668
 669            return mass_spec
 670
 671        d_params = self.set_metadata(
 672            firstScanNumber=self.start_scan, lastScanNumber=self.end_scan
 673        )
 674
 675        # Create the mass options object that will be used when averaging the scans
 676        options = MassOptions()
 677        options.ToleranceUnits = ToleranceUnits.ppm
 678        options.Tolerance = ppm_tolerance
 679
 680        # Get the scan filter for the first scan.  This scan filter will be used to located
 681        # scans within the given scan range of the same type
 682        scanFilter = self.iRawDataPlus.GetFilterForScanNumber(self.start_scan)
 683
 684        # force it to only look for the MSType
 685        scanFilter = self.set_msordertype(scanFilter, ms_type)
 686
 687        if isinstance(self.scans, tuple):
 688            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScansInScanRange(
 689                self.iRawDataPlus, self.start_scan, self.end_scan, scanFilter, options
 690            )
 691
 692            if averageScan:
 693                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
 694                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
 695                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
 696                    )
 697
 698                    return mass_spec
 699
 700                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
 701                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
 702                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
 703
 704                        return mass_spec
 705
 706                    else:
 707                        raise ValueError(
 708                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
 709                        )
 710                else:
 711                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
 712            else:
 713                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
 714
 715        elif isinstance(self.scans, list):
 716            d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=self.scans)
 717
 718            scans = List[int]()
 719            for scan in self.scans:
 720                scans.Add(scan)
 721
 722            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScans(self.iRawDataPlus, scans, options)
 723
 724            if averageScan:
 725                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
 726                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
 727                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
 728                    )
 729
 730                    return mass_spec
 731
 732                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
 733                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
 734                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
 735
 736                        return mass_spec
 737
 738                    else:
 739                        raise ValueError(
 740                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
 741                        )
 742
 743                else:
 744                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
 745
 746            else:
 747                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
 748
 749        else:
 750            raise ValueError("scans must be a list intergers or a tuple if integers")
 751
 752    def set_metadata(
 753        self,
 754        firstScanNumber=0,
 755        lastScanNumber=0,
 756        scans_list=False,
 757        label=Labels.thermo_profile,
 758    ):
 759        """
 760        Collect metadata to be ingested in the mass spectrum object
 761
 762        scans_list: list[int] or false
 763        lastScanNumber: int
 764        firstScanNumber: int
 765        """
 766
 767        d_params = default_parameters(self.file_path)
 768
 769        # assumes scans is full scan or reduced profile scan
 770
 771        d_params["label"] = label
 772
 773        if scans_list:
 774            d_params["scan_number"] = scans_list
 775
 776            d_params["polarity"] = self.get_polarity_mode(scans_list[0])
 777
 778        else:
 779            d_params["scan_number"] = "{}-{}".format(firstScanNumber, lastScanNumber)
 780
 781            d_params["polarity"] = self.get_polarity_mode(firstScanNumber)
 782
 783        d_params["analyzer"] = self.iRawDataPlus.GetInstrumentData().Model
 784
 785        d_params["acquisition_time"] = self.get_creation_time()
 786
 787        d_params["instrument_label"] = self.iRawDataPlus.GetInstrumentData().Name
 788
 789        return d_params
 790
 791    def get_centroid_msms_data(self, scan):
 792        """
 793        .. deprecated:: 2.0
 794            This function will be removed in CoreMS 2.0. Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead for similar functionality.
 795        """
 796
 797        warnings.warn(
 798            "The `get_centroid_msms_data()` is deprecated as of CoreMS 2.0 and will be removed in a future version. "
 799            "Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead.",
 800            DeprecationWarning,
 801        )
 802
 803        d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=[scan], label=Labels.thermo_centroid)
 804
 805        centroidStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetCentroidStream(scan, False)
 806
 807        noise = list(centroidStream.Noises)
 808
 809        baselines = list(centroidStream.Baselines)
 810
 811        rp = list(centroidStream.Resolutions)
 812
 813        magnitude = list(centroidStream.Intensities)
 814
 815        mz = list(centroidStream.Masses)
 816
 817        # charge = scans_labels[5]
 818        array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
 819        l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
 820
 821        d_params["baseline_noise"] = np.average(array_noise_std)
 822
 823        d_params["baseline_noise_std"] = np.std(array_noise_std)
 824
 825        data_dict = {
 826            Labels.mz: mz,
 827            Labels.abundance: magnitude,
 828            Labels.rp: rp,
 829            Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
 830        }
 831
 832        mass_spec = MassSpecCentroid(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=False)
 833        mass_spec.settings.noise_threshold_method = "relative_abundance"
 834        mass_spec.settings.noise_threshold_min_relative_abundance = 1
 835        mass_spec.process_mass_spec()
 836        return mass_spec
 837
 838    def get_average_mass_spectrum_by_scanlist(
 839        self,
 840        scans_list: List[int],
 841        auto_process: bool = True,
 842        ppm_tolerance: float = 5.0,
 843    ) -> MassSpecProfile:
 844        """
 845        Averages selected scans mass spectra using Thermo's AverageScans method
 846        scans_list: list[int]
 847        auto_process: bool
 848            If true performs peak picking, and noise threshold calculation after creation of mass spectrum object
 849        Returns:
 850            MassSpecProfile
 851
 852         .. deprecated:: 2.0
 853        This function will be removed in CoreMS 2.0. Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead for similar functionality.
 854        """
 855
 856        warnings.warn(
 857            "The `get_average_mass_spectrum_by_scanlist()` is deprecated as of CoreMS 2.0 and will be removed in a future version. "
 858            "Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead.",
 859            DeprecationWarning,
 860        )
 861
 862        d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=scans_list)
 863
 864        # assumes scans is full scan or reduced profile scan
 865
 866        scans = List[int]()
 867        for scan in scans_list:
 868            scans.Add(scan)
 869
 870        # Create the mass options object that will be used when averaging the scans
 871        options = MassOptions()
 872        options.ToleranceUnits = ToleranceUnits.ppm
 873        options.Tolerance = ppm_tolerance
 874
 875        # Get the scan filter for the first scan.  This scan filter will be used to located
 876        # scans within the given scan range of the same type
 877
 878        averageScan = Extensions.AverageScans(self.iRawDataPlus, scans, options)
 879
 880        len_data = averageScan.SegmentedScan.Positions.Length
 881
 882        mz_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Positions)
 883        abund_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Intensities)
 884
 885        data_dict = {
 886            Labels.mz: mz_list,
 887            Labels.abundance: abund_list,
 888        }
 889
 890        mass_spec = MassSpecProfile(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process)
 891
 892        return mass_spec

 894
 895class ImportMassSpectraThermoMSFileReader(ThermoBaseClass, SpectraParserInterface):
 896    """A class for parsing Thermo RAW mass spectrometry data files and instatiating MassSpectraBase or LCMSBase objects
 897
 898    Parameters
 899    ----------
 900    file_location : str or Path
 901        The path to the RAW file to be parsed.
 902    analyzer : str, optional
 903        The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument. Default is "Unknown".
 904    instrument_label : str, optional
 905        The name of the instrument used to acquire the data. Default is "Unknown".
 906    sample_name : str, optional
 907        The name of the sample being analyzed. If not provided, the stem of the file_location path will be used.
 908
 909    Attributes
 910    ----------
 911    file_location : Path
 912        The path to the RAW file being parsed.
 913    analyzer : str
 914        The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument.
 915    instrument_label : str
 916        The name of the instrument used to acquire the data.
 917    sample_name : str
 918        The name of the sample being analyzed.
 919
 920    Methods
 921    -------
 922    * run(spectra=True).
 923        Parses the RAW file and returns a dictionary of mass spectra dataframes and a scan metadata dataframe.
 924    * get_mass_spectrum_from_scan(scan_number, polarity, auto_process=True)
 925        Parses the RAW file and returns a MassSpecBase object from a single scan.
 926    * get_mass_spectra_obj().
 927        Parses the RAW file and instantiates a MassSpectraBase object.
 928    * get_lcms_obj().
 929        Parses the RAW file and instantiates an LCMSBase object.
 930    * get_icr_transient_times().
 931        Return a list for transient time targets for all scans, or selected scans range
 932
 933    Inherits from ThermoBaseClass and SpectraParserInterface
 934    """
 935
 936    def __init__(
 937        self,
 938        file_location,
 939        analyzer="Unknown",
 940        instrument_label="Unknown",
 941        sample_name=None,
 942    ):
 943        super().__init__(file_location)
 944        if isinstance(file_location, str):
 945            # if obj is a string it defaults to create a Path obj, pass the S3Path if needed
 946            file_location = Path(file_location)
 947        if not file_location.exists():
 948            raise FileExistsError("File does not exist: " + str(file_location))
 949
 950        self.file_location = file_location
 951        self.analyzer = analyzer
 952        self.instrument_label = instrument_label
 953
 954        if sample_name:
 955            self.sample_name = sample_name
 956        else:
 957            self.sample_name = file_location.stem
 958
 959    def load(self):
 960        pass
 961
 962    def get_scan_df(self):
 963        # This automatically brings in all the data
 964        self.chromatogram_settings.scans = (-1, -1)
 965
 966        # Get scan df info; starting with bulk ms1 and ms2 scans
 967        ms1_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(ms_type="MS", peak_detection=False, smooth=False)
 968        ms1_scan_dict = {
 969            "scan": ms1_tic_data.scans,
 970            "scan_time": ms1_tic_data.time,
 971            "tic": ms1_tic_data.tic,
 972        }
 973        ms1_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms1_scan_dict)
 974        ms1_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms1"
 975
 976        ms2_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(
 977            ms_type="MS2", peak_detection=False, smooth=False
 978        )
 979        ms2_scan_dict = {
 980            "scan": ms2_tic_data.scans,
 981            "scan_time": ms2_tic_data.time,
 982            "tic": ms2_tic_data.tic,
 983        }
 984        ms2_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms2_scan_dict)
 985        ms2_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms2"
 986
 987        scan_df = (
 988            pd.concat([ms1_tic_df, ms2_tic_df], axis=0).sort_values(by="scan").reindex()
 989        )
 990
 991        # get scan text
 992        scan_filter_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(
 993            self.get_all_filters()[0], orient="index"
 994        )
 995        scan_filter_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
 996        scan_filter_df.rename(columns={"index": "scan", 0: "scan_text"}, inplace=True)
 997
 998        scan_df = scan_df.merge(scan_filter_df, on="scan", how="left")
 999        scan_df["scan_window_lower"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1000            r"\[(\d+\.\d+)-\d+\.\d+\]"
1001        )
1002        scan_df["scan_window_upper"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1003            r"\[\d+\.\d+-(\d+\.\d+)\]"
1004        )
1005        scan_df["polarity"] = np.where(
1006            scan_df.scan_text.str.contains(" - "), "negative", "positive"
1007        )
1008        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(r"(\d+\.\d+)@")
1009        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df["precursor_mz"].astype(float)
1010        scan_df["ms_level"] = scan_df["ms_level"].str.replace("ms", "").astype(int)
1011
1012        # Assign each scan as centroid or profile
1013        scan_df["ms_format"] = None
1014        for i in scan_df.scan.to_list():
1015            if self.iRawDataPlus.IsCentroidScanFromScanNumber(i):
1016                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "centroid"
1017            else:
1018                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "profile"
1019
1020        return scan_df
1021
1022    def get_ms_raw(self, spectra, scan_df):
1023        if spectra == "all":
1024            scan_df_forspec = scan_df
1025        elif spectra == "ms1":
1026            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 1]
1027        elif spectra == "ms2":
1028            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 2]
1029        else:
1030            raise ValueError("spectra must be 'none', 'all', 'ms1', or 'ms2'")
1031
1032        # Result container
1033        res = {}
1034
1035        # Row count container
1036        counter = {}
1037
1038        # Column name container
1039        cols = {}
1040
1041        # set at float32
1042        dtype = np.float32
1043
1044        # First pass: get nrows
1045        N = defaultdict(lambda: 0)
1046        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1047            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1048            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1049            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1050                i, scanStatistics
1051            )
1052            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1053            abun = np.array(abun)[np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]]
1054
1055            N[level] += len(abun)
1056
1057        # Second pass: parse
1058        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1059            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1060            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1061                i, scanStatistics
1062            )
1063            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1064            mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1065
1066            # Get index of abun that are > 0
1067            inx = np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]
1068            mz = np.array(mz)[inx]
1069            mz = np.float32(mz)
1070            abun = np.array(abun)[inx]
1071            abun = np.float32(abun)
1072
1073            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1074
1075            # Number of rows
1076            n = len(mz)
1077
1078            # No measurements
1079            if n == 0:
1080                continue
1081
1082            # Dimension check
1083            if len(mz) != len(abun):
1084                warnings.warn("m/z and intensity array dimension mismatch")
1085                continue
1086
1087            # Scan/frame info
1088            id_dict = i
1089
1090            # Columns
1091            cols[level] = ["scan", "mz", "intensity"]
1092            m = len(cols[level])
1093
1094            # Subarray init
1095            arr = np.empty((n, m), dtype=dtype)
1096            inx = 0
1097
1098            # Populate scan/frame info
1099            arr[:, inx] = i
1100            inx += 1
1101
1102            # Populate m/z
1103            arr[:, inx] = mz
1104            inx += 1
1105
1106            # Populate intensity
1107            arr[:, inx] = abun
1108            inx += 1
1109
1110            # Initialize output container
1111            if level not in res:
1112                res[level] = np.empty((N[level], m), dtype=dtype)
1113                counter[level] = 0
1114
1115            # Insert subarray
1116            res[level][counter[level] : counter[level] + n, :] = arr
1117            counter[level] += n
1118
1119        # Construct ms1 and ms2 mz dataframes
1120        for level in res.keys():
1121            res[level] = pd.DataFrame(res[level])
1122            res[level].columns = cols[level]
1123        # rename keys in res to add 'ms' prefix
1124        res = {f"ms{key}": value for key, value in res.items()}
1125
1126        return res
1127
1128    def run(self, spectra="all", scan_df=None):
1129        """
1130        Extracts mass spectra data from a raw file.
1131
1132        Parameters
1133        ----------
1134        spectra : str, optional
1135            Which mass spectra data to include in the output. Default is all.  Other options: none, ms1, ms2.
1136        scan_df : pandas.DataFrame, optional
1137            Scan dataframe.  If not provided, the scan dataframe is created from the mzML file.
1138
1139        Returns
1140        -------
1141        tuple
1142            A tuple containing two elements:
1143            - A dictionary containing mass spectra data, separated by MS level.
1144            - A pandas DataFrame containing scan information, including scan number, scan time, TIC, MS level,
1145                scan text, scan window lower and upper bounds, polarity, and precursor m/z (if applicable).
1146        """
1147        # Prepare scan_df
1148        if scan_df is None:
1149            scan_df = self.get_scan_df()
1150
1151        # Prepare mass spectra data
1152        if spectra != "none":
1153            res = self.get_ms_raw(spectra=spectra, scan_df=scan_df)
1154        else:
1155            res = None
1156
1157        return res, scan_df
1158
1159    def get_mass_spectrum_from_scan(
1160        self, scan_number, spectrum_mode, auto_process=True
1161    ):
1162        """Instatiate a MassSpecBase object from a single scan number from the binary file, currently only supports profile mode.
1163
1164        Parameters
1165        ----------
1166        scan_number : int
1167            The scan number to extract the mass spectrum from.
1168        polarity : int
1169            The polarity of the scan.  1 for positive mode, -1 for negative mode.
1170        spectrum_mode : str
1171            The type of mass spectrum to extract.  Must be 'profile' or 'centroid'.
1172        auto_process : bool, optional
1173            If True, perform peak picking and noise threshold calculation after creating the mass spectrum object. Default is True.
1174
1175        Returns
1176        -------
1177        MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid
1178            The MassSpecProfile or MassSpecCentroid object containing the parsed mass spectrum.
1179        """
1180
1181        if spectrum_mode == "profile":
1182            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(scan_number)
1183            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1184                scan_number, scanStatistics
1185            )
1186            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1187            mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1188            data_dict = {
1189                Labels.mz: mz,
1190                Labels.abundance: abun,
1191            }
1192            d_params = self.set_metadata(
1193                firstScanNumber=scan_number,
1194                lastScanNumber=scan_number,
1195                scans_list=False,
1196                label=Labels.thermo_profile,
1197            )
1198            mass_spectrum_obj = MassSpecProfile(
1199                data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process
1200            )
1201
1202        elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
1203            centroid_scan = self.iRawDataPlus.GetCentroidStream(scan_number, False)
1204            if centroid_scan.Masses is not None:
1205                mz = list(centroid_scan.Masses)
1206                abun = list(centroid_scan.Intensities)
1207                rp = list(centroid_scan.Resolutions)
1208                magnitude = list(centroid_scan.Intensities)
1209                noise = list(centroid_scan.Noises)
1210                baselines = list(centroid_scan.Baselines)
1211                array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
1212                l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
1213                data_dict = {
1214                    Labels.mz: mz,
1215                    Labels.abundance: abun,
1216                    Labels.rp: rp,
1217                    Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
1218                }
1219            else:  # For CID MS2, the centroid data are stored in the profile data location, they do not have any associated rp or baseline data, but they should be treated as centroid data
1220                scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(
1221                    scan_number
1222                )
1223                profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1224                    scan_number, scanStatistics
1225                )
1226                abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1227                mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1228                data_dict = {
1229                    Labels.mz: mz,
1230                    Labels.abundance: abun,
1231                    Labels.rp: [np.nan] * len(mz),
1232                    Labels.s2n: [np.nan] * len(mz),
1233                }
1234            d_params = self.set_metadata(
1235                firstScanNumber=scan_number,
1236                lastScanNumber=scan_number,
1237                scans_list=False,
1238                label=Labels.thermo_centroid,
1239            )
1240            mass_spectrum_obj = MassSpecCentroid(
1241                data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process
1242            )
1243
1244        return mass_spectrum_obj
1245
1246    def get_mass_spectra_obj(self):
1247        """Instatiate a MassSpectraBase object from the binary data file file.
1248
1249        Returns
1250        -------
1251        MassSpectraBase
1252            The MassSpectra object containing the parsed mass spectra.  The object is instatiated with the mzML file, analyzer, instrument, sample name, and scan dataframe.
1253        """
1254        _, scan_df = self.run(spectra="none")
1255        mass_spectra_obj = MassSpectraBase(
1256            self.file_location,
1257            self.analyzer,
1258            self.instrument_label,
1259            self.sample_name,
1260            self,
1261        )
1262        scan_df = scan_df.set_index("scan", drop=False)
1263        mass_spectra_obj.scan_df = scan_df
1264
1265        return mass_spectra_obj
1266
1267    def get_lcms_obj(self, spectra="all"):
1268        """Instatiates a LCMSBase object from the mzML file.
1269
1270        Parameters
1271        ----------
1272        verbose : bool, optional
1273            If True, print progress messages. Default is True.
1274        spectra : str, optional
1275            Which mass spectra data to include in the output. Default is "all".  Other options: "none", "ms1", "ms2".
1276
1277        Returns
1278        -------
1279        LCMSBase
1280            LCMS object containing mass spectra data. The object is instatiated with the file location, analyzer, instrument, sample name, scan info, mz dataframe (as specifified), polarity, as well as the attributes holding the scans, retention times, and tics.
1281        """
1282        _, scan_df = self.run(spectra="none")  # first run it to just get scan info
1283        res, scan_df = self.run(
1284            scan_df=scan_df, spectra=spectra
1285        )  # second run to parse data
1286        lcms_obj = LCMSBase(
1287            self.file_location,
1288            self.analyzer,
1289            self.instrument_label,
1290            self.sample_name,
1291            self,
1292        )
1293        if spectra != "none":
1294            for key in res:
1295                key_int = int(key.replace("ms", ""))
1296                res[key] = res[key][res[key].intensity > 0]
1297                res[key] = (
1298                    res[key].sort_values(by=["scan", "mz"]).reset_index(drop=True)
1299                )
1300                lcms_obj._ms_unprocessed[key_int] = res[key]
1301        lcms_obj.scan_df = scan_df.set_index("scan", drop=False)
1302        # Check if polarity is mixed
1303        if len(set(scan_df.polarity)) > 1:
1304            raise ValueError("Mixed polarities detected in scan data")
1305        lcms_obj.polarity = scan_df.polarity[0]
1306        lcms_obj._scans_number_list = list(scan_df.scan)
1307        lcms_obj._retention_time_list = list(scan_df.scan_time)
1308        lcms_obj._tic_list = list(scan_df.tic)
1309
1310        return lcms_obj
1311
1312    def get_icr_transient_times(self):
1313        """Return a list for transient time targets for all scans, or selected scans range
1314
1315        Notes
1316        --------
1317        Resolving Power and Transient time targets based on 7T FT-ICR MS system
1318        """
1319
1320        res_trans_time = {
1321            "50": 0.384,
1322            "100000": 0.768,
1323            "200000": 1.536,
1324            "400000": 3.072,
1325            "750000": 6.144,
1326            "1000000": 12.288,
1327        }
1328
1329        firstScanNumber = self.start_scan
1330
1331        lastScanNumber = self.end_scan
1332
1333        transient_time_list = []
1334
1335        for scan in range(firstScanNumber, lastScanNumber):
1336            scan_header = self.get_scan_header(scan)
1337
1338            rp_target = scan_header["FT Resolution:"]
1339
1340            transient_time = res_trans_time.get(rp_target)
1341
1342            transient_time_list.append(transient_time)
1343
1344            # print(transient_time, rp_target)
1345
1346        return transient_time_list

208    def set_msordertype(self, scanFilter, mstype: str = "ms1"):
209        """
210        Function to convert user passed string MS Type to Thermo MSOrderType object
211        Limited to MS1 through MS10.
212
213        Parameters:
214        -----------
215        scanFilter : Thermo.ScanFilter
216            The scan filter object.
217        mstype : str, optional
218            The MS Type string, by default 'ms1'
219
220        """
221        mstype = mstype.upper()
222        # Check that a valid mstype is passed
223        if (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) > 10) or (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) < 1):
224            warn("MS Type not valid, must be between MS1 and MS10")
225
226        msordertypedict = {
227            "MS1": MSOrderType.Ms,
228            "MS2": MSOrderType.Ms2,
229            "MS3": MSOrderType.Ms3,
230            "MS4": MSOrderType.Ms4,
231            "MS5": MSOrderType.Ms5,
232            "MS6": MSOrderType.Ms6,
233            "MS7": MSOrderType.Ms7,
234            "MS8": MSOrderType.Ms8,
235            "MS9": MSOrderType.Ms9,
236            "MS10": MSOrderType.Ms10,
237        }
238        scanFilter.MSOrder = msordertypedict[mstype]
239        return scanFilter
240
241    def get_creation_time(self) -> datetime.datetime:
242        """
243        Extract the creation date stamp from the .RAW file
244        Return formatted creation date stamp.
245
246        """
247        credate = self.iRawDataPlus.CreationDate.get_Ticks()
248        credate = datetime.datetime(1, 1, 1) + datetime.timedelta(
249            microseconds=credate / 10
250        )
251        return credate

262    def get_polarity_mode(self, scan_number: int) -> int:
263        """
264        Get the polarity mode for the given scan number.
265
266        Parameters:
267        -----------
268        scan_number : int
269            The scan number.
270
271        Raises:
272        -------
273        Exception
274            If the polarity mode is unknown.
275
276        """
277        polarity_symbol = self.get_filter_for_scan_num(scan_number)[1]
278
279        if polarity_symbol == "+":
280            return 1
281            # return 'POSITIVE_ION_MODE'
282
283        elif polarity_symbol == "-":
284            return -1
285
286        else:
287            raise Exception("Polarity Mode Unknown, please set it manually")

289    def get_filter_for_scan_num(self, scan_number: int) -> List[str]:
290        """
291        Returns the closest matching run time that corresponds to scan_number for the current
292        controller. This function is only supported for MS device controllers.
293        e.g.  ['FTMS', '-', 'p', 'NSI', 'Full', 'ms', '[200.00-1000.00]']
294
295        Parameters:
296        -----------
297        scan_number : int
298            The scan number.
299
300        """
301        scan_label = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanEventStringForScanNumber(scan_number)
302
303        return str(scan_label).split()

305    def check_full_scan(self, scan_number: int) -> bool:
306        # scan_filter.ScanMode 0 = FULL
307        scan_filter = self.iRawDataPlus.GetFilterForScanNumber(scan_number)
308
309        return scan_filter.ScanMode == MSOrderType.Ms

311    def get_all_filters(self) -> Tuple[Dict[int, str], List[str]]:
312        """
313        Get all scan filters.
314        This function is only supported for MS device controllers.
315        e.g.  ['FTMS', '-', 'p', 'NSI', 'Full', 'ms', '[200.00-1000.00]']
316
317        """
318
319        scanrange = range(self.start_scan, self.end_scan + 1)
320        scanfiltersdic = {}
321        scanfilterslist = []
322        for scan_number in scanrange:
323            scan_label = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanEventStringForScanNumber(scan_number)
324            scanfiltersdic[scan_number] = scan_label
325            scanfilterslist.append(scan_label)
326        scanfilterset = list(set(scanfilterslist))
327        return scanfiltersdic, scanfilterset

329    def get_scan_header(self, scan: int) -> Dict[str, Any]:
330        """
331        Get full dictionary of scan header meta data, i.e. AGC status, ion injection time, etc.
332
333        Parameters:
334        -----------
335        scan : int
336            The scan number.
337
338        """
339        header = self.iRawDataPlus.GetTrailerExtraInformation(scan)
340
341        header_dic = {}
342        for i in range(header.Length):
343            header_dic.update({header.Labels[i]: header.Values[i]})
344        return header_dic

379        """
380
381        options = MassOptions()

395
396        # chroma_settings2 = IChromatogramSettings(settings)

403            all_chroma_settings, self.start_scan, self.end_scan, options
404        )
405
406        traces = ChromatogramSignal.FromChromatogramData(data)
407
408        chroma = {}
409
410        if plot:
411            from matplotlib.transforms import Bbox

443                    warn(
444                        "The software assumes same lenth of TIC and EIC, this does not seems to be the case and the results mass spectrum selected by the scan number might not be correct"
445                    )
446

449                    eic_data.apexes = [i for i in centroid_eics]
450
451                    if plot:

455                                time[apex_index],

459                            )

463            ax.set_ylabel("a.u.")
464            ax.set_title(ms_type + " EIC")
465            ax.tick_params(axis="both", which="major", labelsize=12)
466            ax.axes.spines["top"].set_visible(False)
467            ax.axes.spines["right"].set_visible(False)

476                def func(evt):
477                    if legend.contains(evt):

479                        bbox = Bbox.from_bounds(
480                            bbox.x0, bbox.y0 + d[evt.button], bbox.width, bbox.height
481                        )

483                        legend.set_bbox_to_anchor(bbox.transformed(tr))
484                        fig.canvas.draw_idle()
485
486                fig.canvas.mpl_connect("scroll_event", func)
487            return chroma, ax
488        else:
489            return chroma, None
490            rt = []
491            tic = []
492            scans = []
493            for i in range(traces[0].Length):
494                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
495
496                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
497                rt.append(traces[0].Times[i])

499                scans.append(traces[0].Scans[i])

505    def get_tic(
506        self,
507        ms_type="MS !d",
508        peak_detection=True,
509        smooth=True,
510        plot=False,
511        ax=None,
512        trace_type="TIC",
513    ) -> Tuple[TIC_Data, axes.Axes]:
514        """ms_type: str ('MS !d', 'MS2', None)
515            if you use None you get all scans.
516        peak_detection: bool
517        smooth: bool
518        plot: bool
519        ax: matplotlib axis object
520        trace_type: str ('TIC','BPC')
521
522        returns:
523            chroma: dict
524            {
525            Scan: [int]
526                original thermo scan numberMS
527            Time: [floats]
528                list of retention times
529            TIC: [floats]
530                total ion chromatogram
531            Apexes: [int]
532                original thermo apex scan number after peak picking
533            }
534        """
535        if trace_type == "TIC":
536            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.TIC)
537        elif trace_type == "BPC":
538            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.BasePeak)
539        else:
540            raise ValueError(f"{trace_type} undefined")
541        if ms_type == "all":
542            settings.Filter = None
543        else:
544            settings.Filter = ms_type
545
546        chroma_settings = IChromatogramSettings(settings)
547
548        data = self.iRawDataPlus.GetChromatogramData(
549            [chroma_settings], self.start_scan, self.end_scan
550        )
551
552        trace = ChromatogramSignal.FromChromatogramData(data)
553
554        data = TIC_Data(time=[], scans=[], tic=[], bpc=[], apexes=[])
555
556        if trace[0].Length > 0:
557            for i in range(trace[0].Length):
558                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
559
560                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
561                data.time.append(trace[0].Times[i])
562                data.tic.append(trace[0].Intensities[i])
563                data.scans.append(trace[0].Scans[i])
564
565                # print(trace[0].Scans[i])
566            if smooth:
567                data.tic = self.smooth_tic(data.tic)
568
569            else:
570                data.tic = np.array(data.tic)
571
572            if peak_detection:
573                centroid_peak_indexes = [
574                    i for i in self.centroid_detector(data.time, data.tic)
575                ]
576
577                data.apexes = centroid_peak_indexes
578
579            if plot:
580                if not ax:
581                    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
582
583                    ax = plt.gca()
584                    # fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 3))
585
586                ax.plot(data.time, data.tic, label=trace_type)
587                ax.set_xlabel("Time (min)")
588                ax.set_ylabel("a.u.")
589                if peak_detection:
590                    for peak_indexes in data.apexes:
591                        apex_index = peak_indexes[1]
592                        ax.plot(
593                            data.time[apex_index],
594                            data.tic[apex_index],
595                            marker="x",
596                            linewidth=0,
597                        )
598
599                # plt.show()
600                if trace_type == "BPC":
601                    data.bpc = data.tic
602                    data.tic = []
603                return data, ax
604            if trace_type == "BPC":
605                data.bpc = data.tic
606                data.tic = []
607            return data, None
608
609        else:
610            return None, None

612    def get_average_mass_spectrum(
613        self,
614        spectrum_mode: str = "profile",
615        auto_process: bool = True,
616        ppm_tolerance: float = 5.0,
617        ms_type: str = "MS1",
618    ) -> MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid:
619        """
620        Averages mass spectra over a scan range using Thermo's AverageScansInScanRange method
621        or a scan list using Thermo's AverageScans method
622        spectrum_mode: str
623            centroid or profile mass spectrum
624        auto_process: bool
625            If true performs peak picking, and noise threshold calculation after creation of mass spectrum object
626        ms_type: str
627            String of form 'ms1' or 'ms2' or 'MS3' etc. Valid up to MS10.
628            Internal function converts to Thermo MSOrderType class.
629
630        """
631
632        def get_profile_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict, auto_process: bool):
633            mz_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Positions)
634            abund_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Intensities)
635
636            data_dict = {
637                Labels.mz: mz_list,
638                Labels.abundance: abund_list,
639            }
640
641            return MassSpecProfile(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process)
642
643        def get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict):
644            noise = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Noises)
645
646            baselines = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Baselines)
647
648            rp = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Resolutions)
649
650            magnitude = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Intensities)
651
652            mz = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Masses)
653
654            array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
655            l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
656
657            d_params["baseline_noise"] = np.average(array_noise_std)
658
659            d_params["baseline_noise_std"] = np.std(array_noise_std)
660
661            data_dict = {
662                Labels.mz: mz,
663                Labels.abundance: magnitude,
664                Labels.rp: rp,
665                Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
666            }
667
668            mass_spec = MassSpecCentroid(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=False)
669
670            return mass_spec
671
672        d_params = self.set_metadata(
673            firstScanNumber=self.start_scan, lastScanNumber=self.end_scan
674        )
675
676        # Create the mass options object that will be used when averaging the scans
677        options = MassOptions()
678        options.ToleranceUnits = ToleranceUnits.ppm
679        options.Tolerance = ppm_tolerance
680
681        # Get the scan filter for the first scan.  This scan filter will be used to located
682        # scans within the given scan range of the same type
683        scanFilter = self.iRawDataPlus.GetFilterForScanNumber(self.start_scan)
684
685        # force it to only look for the MSType
686        scanFilter = self.set_msordertype(scanFilter, ms_type)
687
688        if isinstance(self.scans, tuple):
689            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScansInScanRange(
690                self.iRawDataPlus, self.start_scan, self.end_scan, scanFilter, options
691            )
692
693            if averageScan:
694                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
695                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
696                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
697                    )
698
699                    return mass_spec
700
701                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
702                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
703                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
704
705                        return mass_spec
706
707                    else:
708                        raise ValueError(
709                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
710                        )
711                else:
712                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
713            else:
714                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
715
716        elif isinstance(self.scans, list):
717            d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=self.scans)
718
719            scans = List[int]()
720            for scan in self.scans:
721                scans.Add(scan)
722
723            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScans(self.iRawDataPlus, scans, options)
724
725            if averageScan:
726                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
727                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
728                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
729                    )
730
731                    return mass_spec
732
733                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
734                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
735                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
736
737                        return mass_spec
738
739                    else:
740                        raise ValueError(
741                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
742                        )
743
744                else:
745                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
746
747            else:
748                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
749
750        else:
751            raise ValueError("scans must be a list intergers or a tuple if integers")
752
753    def set_metadata(
754        self,
755        firstScanNumber=0,
756        lastScanNumber=0,
757        scans_list=False,
758        label=Labels.thermo_profile,
759    ):
760        """
761        Collect metadata to be ingested in the mass spectrum object
762
763        scans_list: list[int] or false
764        lastScanNumber: int
765        firstScanNumber: int
766        """
767
768        d_params = default_parameters(self.file_path)
769
770        # assumes scans is full scan or reduced profile scan
771
772        d_params["label"] = label
773
774        if scans_list:
775            d_params["scan_number"] = scans_list
776
777            d_params["polarity"] = self.get_polarity_mode(scans_list[0])
778
779        else:
780            d_params["scan_number"] = "{}-{}".format(firstScanNumber, lastScanNumber)
781
782            d_params["polarity"] = self.get_polarity_mode(firstScanNumber)
783
784        d_params["analyzer"] = self.iRawDataPlus.GetInstrumentData().Model
785
786        d_params["acquisition_time"] = self.get_creation_time()
787
788        d_params["instrument_label"] = self.iRawDataPlus.GetInstrumentData().Name
789
790        return d_params
791
792    def get_centroid_msms_data(self, scan):
793        """
794        .. deprecated:: 2.0
795            This function will be removed in CoreMS 2.0. Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead for similar functionality.
796        """
797
798        warnings.warn(
799            "The `get_centroid_msms_data()` is deprecated as of CoreMS 2.0 and will be removed in a future version. "
800            "Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead.",
801            DeprecationWarning,
802        )
803
804        d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=[scan], label=Labels.thermo_centroid)
805
806        centroidStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetCentroidStream(scan, False)
807
808        noise = list(centroidStream.Noises)
809
810        baselines = list(centroidStream.Baselines)
811
812        rp = list(centroidStream.Resolutions)
813
814        magnitude = list(centroidStream.Intensities)
815
816        mz = list(centroidStream.Masses)
817
818        # charge = scans_labels[5]
819        array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
820        l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
821
822        d_params["baseline_noise"] = np.average(array_noise_std)
823
824        d_params["baseline_noise_std"] = np.std(array_noise_std)
825
826        data_dict = {
827            Labels.mz: mz,
828            Labels.abundance: magnitude,
829            Labels.rp: rp,
830            Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
831        }
832
833        mass_spec = MassSpecCentroid(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=False)
834        mass_spec.settings.noise_threshold_method = "relative_abundance"
835        mass_spec.settings.noise_threshold_min_relative_abundance = 1
836        mass_spec.process_mass_spec()
837        return mass_spec

855        """

859            "Please use `get_average_mass_spectrum()` instead.",
860            DeprecationWarning,
861        )
862
863        d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=scans_list)
864
865        # assumes scans is full scan or reduced profile scan

884        abund_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Intensities)

ThermoBaseClass(file_location) 
110    def __init__(self, file_location):
111        """file_location: srt pathlib.Path or s3path.S3Path
112        Thermo Raw file path
113        """
114        # Thread.__init__(self)
115        if isinstance(file_location, str):
116            file_path = Path(file_location)
117
118        elif isinstance(file_location, S3Path):
119            temp_dir = Path("tmp/")
120            temp_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
121
122            file_path = temp_dir / file_location.name
123            with open(file_path, "wb") as fh:
124                fh.write(file_location.read_bytes())
125
126        else:
127            file_path = file_location
128
129        self.iRawDataPlus = RawFileReaderAdapter.FileFactory(str(file_path))
130
131        if not self.iRawDataPlus.IsOpen:
132            raise FileNotFoundError(
133                "Unable to access the RAW file using the RawFileReader class!"
134            )
135
136        # Check for any errors in the RAW file
137        if self.iRawDataPlus.IsError:
138            raise IOError(
139                "Error opening ({}) - {}".format(self.iRawDataPlus.FileError, file_path)
140            )
141
142        self.res = self.iRawDataPlus.SelectInstrument(Device.MS, 1)
143
144        self.file_path = file_location
145        self.iFileHeader = FileHeaderReaderFactory.ReadFile(str(file_path))
146
147        # removing tmp file
148
149        self._init_settings()

def set_msordertype(self, scanFilter, mstype: str = 'ms1'): 
208    def set_msordertype(self, scanFilter, mstype: str = "ms1"):
209        """
210        Function to convert user passed string MS Type to Thermo MSOrderType object
211        Limited to MS1 through MS10.
212
213        Parameters:
214        -----------
215        scanFilter : Thermo.ScanFilter
216            The scan filter object.
217        mstype : str, optional
218            The MS Type string, by default 'ms1'
219
220        """
221        mstype = mstype.upper()
222        # Check that a valid mstype is passed
223        if (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) > 10) or (int(mstype.split("MS")[1]) < 1):
224            warn("MS Type not valid, must be between MS1 and MS10")
225
226        msordertypedict = {
227            "MS1": MSOrderType.Ms,
228            "MS2": MSOrderType.Ms2,
229            "MS3": MSOrderType.Ms3,
230            "MS4": MSOrderType.Ms4,
231            "MS5": MSOrderType.Ms5,
232            "MS6": MSOrderType.Ms6,
233            "MS7": MSOrderType.Ms7,
234            "MS8": MSOrderType.Ms8,
235            "MS9": MSOrderType.Ms9,
236            "MS10": MSOrderType.Ms10,
237        }
238        scanFilter.MSOrder = msordertypedict[mstype]
239        return scanFilter

Function to convert user passed string MS Type to Thermo MSOrderType object Limited to MS1 through MS10.

Parameters:

scanFilter : Thermo.ScanFilter The scan filter object. mstype : str, optional The MS Type string, by default 'ms1'

def get_creation_time(self) -> datetime.datetime: 
241    def get_creation_time(self) -> datetime.datetime:
242        """
243        Extract the creation date stamp from the .RAW file
244        Return formatted creation date stamp.
245
246        """
247        credate = self.iRawDataPlus.CreationDate.get_Ticks()
248        credate = datetime.datetime(1, 1, 1) + datetime.timedelta(
249            microseconds=credate / 10
250        )
251        return credate

def get_polarity_mode(self, scan_number: int) -> int: 
262    def get_polarity_mode(self, scan_number: int) -> int:
263        """
264        Get the polarity mode for the given scan number.
265
266        Parameters:
267        -----------
268        scan_number : int
269            The scan number.

273        Exception

def get_all_filters(self) -> Tuple[Dict[int, str], System.Collections.Generic.List[String]]: 
311    def get_all_filters(self) -> Tuple[Dict[int, str], List[str]]:
312        """
313        Get all scan filters.
314        This function is only supported for MS device controllers.
315        e.g.  ['FTMS', '-', 'p', 'NSI', 'Full', 'ms', '[200.00-1000.00]']
316
317        """
318
319        scanrange = range(self.start_scan, self.end_scan + 1)
320        scanfiltersdic = {}
321        scanfilterslist = []
322        for scan_number in scanrange:
323            scan_label = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanEventStringForScanNumber(scan_number)
324            scanfiltersdic[scan_number] = scan_label
325            scanfilterslist.append(scan_label)
326        scanfilterset = list(set(scanfilterslist))
327        return scanfiltersdic, scanfilterset

494                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
495
496                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
497                rt.append(traces[0].Times[i])
498                tic.append(traces[0].Intensities[i])
499                scans.append(traces[0].Scans[i])
500
501            return traces
502            # plot_chroma(rt, tic)
503            # plt.show()

ms_type: str ('MS', MS2') start_scan: int default -1 will select the lowest available end_scan: int default -1 will select the highest available

                                list of retention times
                            TIC: [floats]
