def get_tic( self, ms_type='MS !d', peak_detection=True, smooth=True, plot=False, ax=None, trace_type='TIC') -> Tuple[corems.mass_spectra.factory.chromat_data.TIC_Data, matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes]: 
505    def get_tic(
506        self,
507        ms_type="MS !d",
508        peak_detection=True,
509        smooth=True,
510        plot=False,
511        ax=None,
512        trace_type="TIC",
513    ) -> Tuple[TIC_Data, axes.Axes]:
514        """ms_type: str ('MS !d', 'MS2', None)
515            if you use None you get all scans.
516        peak_detection: bool
517        smooth: bool
518        plot: bool
519        ax: matplotlib axis object
520        trace_type: str ('TIC','BPC')
521
522        returns:
523            chroma: dict
524            {
525            Scan: [int]
526                original thermo scan numberMS
527            Time: [floats]
528                list of retention times
529            TIC: [floats]
530                total ion chromatogram
531            Apexes: [int]
532                original thermo apex scan number after peak picking
533            }
534        """
535        if trace_type == "TIC":
536            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.TIC)
537        elif trace_type == "BPC":
538            settings = ChromatogramTraceSettings(TraceType.BasePeak)
539        else:
540            raise ValueError(f"{trace_type} undefined")
541        if ms_type == "all":
542            settings.Filter = None
543        else:
544            settings.Filter = ms_type
545
546        chroma_settings = IChromatogramSettings(settings)
547
548        data = self.iRawDataPlus.GetChromatogramData(
549            [chroma_settings], self.start_scan, self.end_scan
550        )
551
552        trace = ChromatogramSignal.FromChromatogramData(data)
553
554        data = TIC_Data(time=[], scans=[], tic=[], bpc=[], apexes=[])
555
556        if trace[0].Length > 0:
557            for i in range(trace[0].Length):
558                # print(trace[0].HasBasePeakData,trace[0].EndTime )
559
560                # print("  {} - {}, {}".format( i, trace[0].Times[i], trace[0].Intensities[i] ))
561                data.time.append(trace[0].Times[i])
562                data.tic.append(trace[0].Intensities[i])
563                data.scans.append(trace[0].Scans[i])
564
565                # print(trace[0].Scans[i])
566            if smooth:
567                data.tic = self.smooth_tic(data.tic)
568
569            else:
570                data.tic = np.array(data.tic)
571
572            if peak_detection:
573                centroid_peak_indexes = [
574                    i for i in self.centroid_detector(data.time, data.tic)
575                ]
576
577                data.apexes = centroid_peak_indexes
578
579            if plot:
580                if not ax:
581                    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
582
583                    ax = plt.gca()
584                    # fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 3))
585
586                ax.plot(data.time, data.tic, label=trace_type)
587                ax.set_xlabel("Time (min)")
588                ax.set_ylabel("a.u.")
589                if peak_detection:
590                    for peak_indexes in data.apexes:
591                        apex_index = peak_indexes[1]
592                        ax.plot(
593                            data.time[apex_index],
594                            data.tic[apex_index],
595                            marker="x",
596                            linewidth=0,
597                        )
598
599                # plt.show()
600                if trace_type == "BPC":
601                    data.bpc = data.tic
602                    data.tic = []
603                return data, ax
604            if trace_type == "BPC":
605                data.bpc = data.tic
606                data.tic = []
607            return data, None
608
609        else:
610            return None, None

ms_type: str ('MS !d', 'MS2', None) if you use None you get all scans. peak_detection: bool smooth: bool plot: bool ax: matplotlib axis object trace_type: str ('TIC','BPC')

returns: chroma: dict { Scan: [int] original thermo scan numberMS Time: [floats] list of retention times TIC: [floats] total ion chromatogram Apexes: [int] original thermo apex scan number after peak picking }

def get_average_mass_spectrum( self, spectrum_mode: str = 'profile', auto_process: bool = True, ppm_tolerance: float = 5.0, ms_type: str = 'MS1') -> corems.mass_spectrum.factory.MassSpectrumClasses.MassSpecProfile | corems.mass_spectrum.factory.MassSpectrumClasses.MassSpecCentroid: 
612    def get_average_mass_spectrum(
613        self,
614        spectrum_mode: str = "profile",
615        auto_process: bool = True,
616        ppm_tolerance: float = 5.0,
617        ms_type: str = "MS1",
618    ) -> MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid:
619        """
620        Averages mass spectra over a scan range using Thermo's AverageScansInScanRange method
621        or a scan list using Thermo's AverageScans method
622        spectrum_mode: str
623            centroid or profile mass spectrum
624        auto_process: bool
625            If true performs peak picking, and noise threshold calculation after creation of mass spectrum object
626        ms_type: str
627            String of form 'ms1' or 'ms2' or 'MS3' etc. Valid up to MS10.
628            Internal function converts to Thermo MSOrderType class.
629
630        """
631
632        def get_profile_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict, auto_process: bool):
633            mz_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Positions)
634            abund_list = list(averageScan.SegmentedScan.Intensities)
635
636            data_dict = {
637                Labels.mz: mz_list,
638                Labels.abundance: abund_list,
639            }
640
641            return MassSpecProfile(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process)
642
643        def get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params: dict):
644            noise = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Noises)
645
646            baselines = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Baselines)
647
648            rp = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Resolutions)
649
650            magnitude = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Intensities)
651
652            mz = list(averageScan.centroidScan.Masses)
653
654            array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
655            l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
656
657            d_params["baseline_noise"] = np.average(array_noise_std)
658
659            d_params["baseline_noise_std"] = np.std(array_noise_std)
660
661            data_dict = {
662                Labels.mz: mz,
663                Labels.abundance: magnitude,
664                Labels.rp: rp,
665                Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
666            }
667
668            mass_spec = MassSpecCentroid(data_dict, d_params, auto_process=False)
669
670            return mass_spec
671
672        d_params = self.set_metadata(
673            firstScanNumber=self.start_scan, lastScanNumber=self.end_scan
674        )
675
676        # Create the mass options object that will be used when averaging the scans
677        options = MassOptions()
678        options.ToleranceUnits = ToleranceUnits.ppm
679        options.Tolerance = ppm_tolerance
680
681        # Get the scan filter for the first scan.  This scan filter will be used to located
682        # scans within the given scan range of the same type
683        scanFilter = self.iRawDataPlus.GetFilterForScanNumber(self.start_scan)
684
685        # force it to only look for the MSType
686        scanFilter = self.set_msordertype(scanFilter, ms_type)
687
688        if isinstance(self.scans, tuple):
689            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScansInScanRange(
690                self.iRawDataPlus, self.start_scan, self.end_scan, scanFilter, options
691            )
692
693            if averageScan:
694                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
695                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
696                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
697                    )
698
699                    return mass_spec
700
701                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
702                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
703                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
704
705                        return mass_spec
706
707                    else:
708                        raise ValueError(
709                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
710                        )
711                else:
712                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
713            else:
714                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
715
716        elif isinstance(self.scans, list):
717            d_params = self.set_metadata(scans_list=self.scans)
718
719            scans = List[int]()
720            for scan in self.scans:
721                scans.Add(scan)
722
723            averageScan = Extensions.AverageScans(self.iRawDataPlus, scans, options)
724
725            if averageScan:
726                if spectrum_mode == "profile":
727                    mass_spec = get_profile_mass_spec(
728                        averageScan, d_params, auto_process
729                    )
730
731                    return mass_spec
732
733                elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
734                    if averageScan.HasCentroidStream:
735                        mass_spec = get_centroid_mass_spec(averageScan, d_params)
736
737                        return mass_spec
738
739                    else:
740                        raise ValueError(
741                            "No Centroind data available for the selected scans"
742                        )
743
744                else:
745                    raise ValueError("spectrum_mode must be 'profile' or centroid")
746
747            else:
748                raise ValueError("No data found for the selected scans")
749
750        else:
751            raise ValueError("scans must be a list intergers or a tuple if integers")

Averages mass spectra over a scan range using Thermo's AverageScansInScanRange method or a scan list using Thermo's AverageScans method spectrum_mode: str centroid or profile mass spectrum auto_process: bool If true performs peak picking, and noise threshold calculation after creation of mass spectrum object ms_type: str String of form 'ms1' or 'ms2' or 'MS3' etc. Valid up to MS10. Internal function converts to Thermo MSOrderType class.

class ImportMassSpectraThermoMSFileReader(ThermoBaseClass, corems.mass_spectra.input.parserbase.SpectraParserInterface): 
 896class ImportMassSpectraThermoMSFileReader(ThermoBaseClass, SpectraParserInterface):
 897    """A class for parsing Thermo RAW mass spectrometry data files and instatiating MassSpectraBase or LCMSBase objects
 898
 899    Parameters
 900    ----------
 901    file_location : str or Path
 902        The path to the RAW file to be parsed.
 903    analyzer : str, optional
 904        The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument. Default is "Unknown".
 905    instrument_label : str, optional
 906        The name of the instrument used to acquire the data. Default is "Unknown".
 907    sample_name : str, optional
 908        The name of the sample being analyzed. If not provided, the stem of the file_location path will be used.
 909
 910    Attributes
 911    ----------
 912    file_location : Path
 913        The path to the RAW file being parsed.
 914    analyzer : str
 915        The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument.
 916    instrument_label : str
 917        The name of the instrument used to acquire the data.
 918    sample_name : str
 919        The name of the sample being analyzed.
 920
 921    Methods
 922    -------
 923    * run(spectra=True).
 924        Parses the RAW file and returns a dictionary of mass spectra dataframes and a scan metadata dataframe.
 925    * get_mass_spectrum_from_scan(scan_number, polarity, auto_process=True)
 926        Parses the RAW file and returns a MassSpecBase object from a single scan.
 927    * get_mass_spectra_obj().
 928        Parses the RAW file and instantiates a MassSpectraBase object.
 929    * get_lcms_obj().
 930        Parses the RAW file and instantiates an LCMSBase object.
 931    * get_icr_transient_times().
 932        Return a list for transient time targets for all scans, or selected scans range
 933
 934    Inherits from ThermoBaseClass and SpectraParserInterface
 935    """
 936
 937    def __init__(
 938        self,
 939        file_location,
 940        analyzer="Unknown",
 941        instrument_label="Unknown",
 942        sample_name=None,
 943    ):
 944        super().__init__(file_location)
 945        if isinstance(file_location, str):
 946            # if obj is a string it defaults to create a Path obj, pass the S3Path if needed
 947            file_location = Path(file_location)
 948        if not file_location.exists():
 949            raise FileExistsError("File does not exist: " + str(file_location))
 950
 951        self.file_location = file_location
 952        self.analyzer = analyzer
 953        self.instrument_label = instrument_label
 954
 955        if sample_name:
 956            self.sample_name = sample_name
 957        else:
 958            self.sample_name = file_location.stem
 959
 960    def load(self):
 961        pass
 962
 963    def get_scan_df(self):
 964        # This automatically brings in all the data
 965        self.chromatogram_settings.scans = (-1, -1)
 966
 967        # Get scan df info; starting with bulk ms1 and ms2 scans
 968        ms1_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(ms_type="MS", peak_detection=False, smooth=False)
 969        ms1_scan_dict = {
 970            "scan": ms1_tic_data.scans,
 971            "scan_time": ms1_tic_data.time,
 972            "tic": ms1_tic_data.tic,
 973        }
 974        ms1_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms1_scan_dict)
 975        ms1_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms1"
 976
 977        ms2_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(
 978            ms_type="MS2", peak_detection=False, smooth=False
 979        )
 980        ms2_scan_dict = {
 981            "scan": ms2_tic_data.scans,
 982            "scan_time": ms2_tic_data.time,
 983            "tic": ms2_tic_data.tic,
 984        }
 985        ms2_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms2_scan_dict)
 986        ms2_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms2"
 987
 988        scan_df = (
 989            pd.concat([ms1_tic_df, ms2_tic_df], axis=0).sort_values(by="scan").reindex()
 990        )
 991
 992        # get scan text
 993        scan_filter_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(
 994            self.get_all_filters()[0], orient="index"
 995        )
 996        scan_filter_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
 997        scan_filter_df.rename(columns={"index": "scan", 0: "scan_text"}, inplace=True)
 998
 999        scan_df = scan_df.merge(scan_filter_df, on="scan", how="left")
1000        scan_df["scan_window_lower"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1001            r"\[(\d+\.\d+)-\d+\.\d+\]"
1002        )
1003        scan_df["scan_window_upper"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1004            r"\[\d+\.\d+-(\d+\.\d+)\]"
1005        )
1006        scan_df["polarity"] = np.where(
1007            scan_df.scan_text.str.contains(" - "), "negative", "positive"
1008        )
1009        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(r"(\d+\.\d+)@")
1010        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df["precursor_mz"].astype(float)
1011        scan_df["ms_level"] = scan_df["ms_level"].str.replace("ms", "").astype(int)
1012
1013        # Assign each scan as centroid or profile
1014        scan_df["ms_format"] = None
1015        for i in scan_df.scan.to_list():
1016            if self.iRawDataPlus.IsCentroidScanFromScanNumber(i):
1017                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "centroid"
1018            else:
1019                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "profile"
1020
1021        return scan_df
1022
1023    def get_ms_raw(self, spectra, scan_df):
1024        if spectra == "all":
1025            scan_df_forspec = scan_df
1026        elif spectra == "ms1":
1027            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 1]
1028        elif spectra == "ms2":
1029            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 2]
1030        else:
1031            raise ValueError("spectra must be 'none', 'all', 'ms1', or 'ms2'")
1032
1033        # Result container
1034        res = {}
1035
1036        # Row count container
1037        counter = {}
1038
1039        # Column name container
1040        cols = {}
1041
1042        # set at float32
1043        dtype = np.float32
1044
1045        # First pass: get nrows
1046        N = defaultdict(lambda: 0)
1047        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1048            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1049            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1050            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1051                i, scanStatistics
1052            )
1053            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1054            abun = np.array(abun)[np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]]
1055
1056            N[level] += len(abun)
1057
1058        # Second pass: parse
1059        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1060            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1061            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1062                i, scanStatistics
1063            )
1064            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1065            mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1066
1067            # Get index of abun that are > 0
1068            inx = np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]
1069            mz = np.array(mz)[inx]
1070            mz = np.float32(mz)
1071            abun = np.array(abun)[inx]
1072            abun = np.float32(abun)
1073
1074            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1075
1076            # Number of rows
1077            n = len(mz)
1078
1079            # No measurements
1080            if n == 0:
1081                continue
1082
1083            # Dimension check
1084            if len(mz) != len(abun):
1085                warnings.warn("m/z and intensity array dimension mismatch")
1086                continue
1087
1088            # Scan/frame info
1089            id_dict = i
1090
1091            # Columns
1092            cols[level] = ["scan", "mz", "intensity"]
1093            m = len(cols[level])
1094
1095            # Subarray init
1096            arr = np.empty((n, m), dtype=dtype)
1097            inx = 0
1098
1099            # Populate scan/frame info
1100            arr[:, inx] = i
1101            inx += 1
1102
1103            # Populate m/z
1104            arr[:, inx] = mz
1105            inx += 1
1106
1107            # Populate intensity
1108            arr[:, inx] = abun
1109            inx += 1
1110
1111            # Initialize output container
1112            if level not in res:
1113                res[level] = np.empty((N[level], m), dtype=dtype)
1114                counter[level] = 0
1115
1116            # Insert subarray
1117            res[level][counter[level] : counter[level] + n, :] = arr
1118            counter[level] += n
1119
1120        # Construct ms1 and ms2 mz dataframes
1121        for level in res.keys():
1122            res[level] = pd.DataFrame(res[level])
1123            res[level].columns = cols[level]
1124        # rename keys in res to add 'ms' prefix
1125        res = {f"ms{key}": value for key, value in res.items()}
1126
1127        return res
1128
1129    def run(self, spectra="all", scan_df=None):
1130        """
1131        Extracts mass spectra data from a raw file.
1132
1133        Parameters
1134        ----------
1135        spectra : str, optional
1136            Which mass spectra data to include in the output. Default is all.  Other options: none, ms1, ms2.
1137        scan_df : pandas.DataFrame, optional
1138            Scan dataframe.  If not provided, the scan dataframe is created from the mzML file.
1139
1140        Returns
1141        -------
1142        tuple
1143            A tuple containing two elements:
1144            - A dictionary containing mass spectra data, separated by MS level.
1145            - A pandas DataFrame containing scan information, including scan number, scan time, TIC, MS level,
1146                scan text, scan window lower and upper bounds, polarity, and precursor m/z (if applicable).
1147        """
1148        # Prepare scan_df
1149        if scan_df is None:
1150            scan_df = self.get_scan_df()
1151
1152        # Prepare mass spectra data
1153        if spectra != "none":
1154            res = self.get_ms_raw(spectra=spectra, scan_df=scan_df)
1155        else:
1156            res = None
1157
1158        return res, scan_df
1159
1160    def get_mass_spectrum_from_scan(
1161        self, scan_number, spectrum_mode, auto_process=True
1162    ):
1163        """Instatiate a MassSpecBase object from a single scan number from the binary file, currently only supports profile mode.
1164
1165        Parameters
1166        ----------
1167        scan_number : int
1168            The scan number to extract the mass spectrum from.
1169        polarity : int
1170            The polarity of the scan.  1 for positive mode, -1 for negative mode.
1171        spectrum_mode : str
1172            The type of mass spectrum to extract.  Must be 'profile' or 'centroid'.
1173        auto_process : bool, optional
1174            If True, perform peak picking and noise threshold calculation after creating the mass spectrum object. Default is True.
1175
1176        Returns
1177        -------
1178        MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid
1179            The MassSpecProfile or MassSpecCentroid object containing the parsed mass spectrum.
1180        """
1181
1182        if spectrum_mode == "profile":
1183            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(scan_number)
1184            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1185                scan_number, scanStatistics
1186            )
1187            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1188            mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1189            data_dict = {
1190                Labels.mz: mz,
1191                Labels.abundance: abun,
1192            }
1193            d_params = self.set_metadata(
1194                firstScanNumber=scan_number,
1195                lastScanNumber=scan_number,
1196                scans_list=False,
1197                label=Labels.thermo_profile,
1198            )
1199            mass_spectrum_obj = MassSpecProfile(
1200                data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process
1201            )
1202
1203        elif spectrum_mode == "centroid":
1204            centroid_scan = self.iRawDataPlus.GetCentroidStream(scan_number, False)
1205            if centroid_scan.Masses is not None:
1206                mz = list(centroid_scan.Masses)
1207                abun = list(centroid_scan.Intensities)
1208                rp = list(centroid_scan.Resolutions)
1209                magnitude = list(centroid_scan.Intensities)
1210                noise = list(centroid_scan.Noises)
1211                baselines = list(centroid_scan.Baselines)
1212                array_noise_std = (np.array(noise) - np.array(baselines)) / 3
1213                l_signal_to_noise = np.array(magnitude) / array_noise_std
1214                data_dict = {
1215                    Labels.mz: mz,
1216                    Labels.abundance: abun,
1217                    Labels.rp: rp,
1218                    Labels.s2n: list(l_signal_to_noise),
1219                }
1220            else:  # For CID MS2, the centroid data are stored in the profile data location, they do not have any associated rp or baseline data, but they should be treated as centroid data
1221                scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(
1222                    scan_number
1223                )
1224                profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1225                    scan_number, scanStatistics
1226                )
1227                abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1228                mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1229                data_dict = {
1230                    Labels.mz: mz,
1231                    Labels.abundance: abun,
1232                    Labels.rp: [np.nan] * len(mz),
1233                    Labels.s2n: [np.nan] * len(mz),
1234                }
1235            d_params = self.set_metadata(
1236                firstScanNumber=scan_number,
1237                lastScanNumber=scan_number,
1238                scans_list=False,
1239                label=Labels.thermo_centroid,
1240            )
1241            mass_spectrum_obj = MassSpecCentroid(
1242                data_dict, d_params, auto_process=auto_process
1243            )
1244
1245        return mass_spectrum_obj
1246
1247    def get_mass_spectra_obj(self):
1248        """Instatiate a MassSpectraBase object from the binary data file file.
1249
1250        Returns
1251        -------
1252        MassSpectraBase
1253            The MassSpectra object containing the parsed mass spectra.  The object is instatiated with the mzML file, analyzer, instrument, sample name, and scan dataframe.
1254        """
1255        _, scan_df = self.run(spectra="none")
1256        mass_spectra_obj = MassSpectraBase(
1257            self.file_location,
1258            self.analyzer,
1259            self.instrument_label,
1260            self.sample_name,
1261            self,
1262        )
1263        scan_df = scan_df.set_index("scan", drop=False)
1264        mass_spectra_obj.scan_df = scan_df
1265
1266        return mass_spectra_obj
1267
1268    def get_lcms_obj(self, spectra="all"):
1269        """Instatiates a LCMSBase object from the mzML file.
1270
1271        Parameters
1272        ----------
1273        verbose : bool, optional
1274            If True, print progress messages. Default is True.
1275        spectra : str, optional
1276            Which mass spectra data to include in the output. Default is "all".  Other options: "none", "ms1", "ms2".
1277
1278        Returns
1279        -------
1280        LCMSBase
1281            LCMS object containing mass spectra data. The object is instatiated with the file location, analyzer, instrument, sample name, scan info, mz dataframe (as specifified), polarity, as well as the attributes holding the scans, retention times, and tics.
1282        """
1283        _, scan_df = self.run(spectra="none")  # first run it to just get scan info
1284        res, scan_df = self.run(
1285            scan_df=scan_df, spectra=spectra
1286        )  # second run to parse data
1287        lcms_obj = LCMSBase(
1288            self.file_location,
1289            self.analyzer,
1290            self.instrument_label,
1291            self.sample_name,
1292            self,
1293        )
1294        if spectra != "none":
1295            for key in res:
1296                key_int = int(key.replace("ms", ""))
1297                res[key] = res[key][res[key].intensity > 0]
1298                res[key] = (
1299                    res[key].sort_values(by=["scan", "mz"]).reset_index(drop=True)
1300                )
1301                lcms_obj._ms_unprocessed[key_int] = res[key]
1302        lcms_obj.scan_df = scan_df.set_index("scan", drop=False)
1303        # Check if polarity is mixed
1304        if len(set(scan_df.polarity)) > 1:
1305            raise ValueError("Mixed polarities detected in scan data")
1306        lcms_obj.polarity = scan_df.polarity[0]
1307        lcms_obj._scans_number_list = list(scan_df.scan)
1308        lcms_obj._retention_time_list = list(scan_df.scan_time)
1309        lcms_obj._tic_list = list(scan_df.tic)
1310
1311        return lcms_obj
1312
1313    def get_icr_transient_times(self):
1314        """Return a list for transient time targets for all scans, or selected scans range
1315
1316        Notes
1317        --------
1318        Resolving Power and Transient time targets based on 7T FT-ICR MS system
1319        """
1320
1321        res_trans_time = {
1322            "50": 0.384,
1323            "100000": 0.768,
1324            "200000": 1.536,
1325            "400000": 3.072,
1326            "750000": 6.144,
1327            "1000000": 12.288,
1328        }
1329
1330        firstScanNumber = self.start_scan
1331
1332        lastScanNumber = self.end_scan
1333
1334        transient_time_list = []
1335
1336        for scan in range(firstScanNumber, lastScanNumber):
1337            scan_header = self.get_scan_header(scan)
1338
1339            rp_target = scan_header["FT Resolution:"]
1340
1341            transient_time = res_trans_time.get(rp_target)
1342
1343            transient_time_list.append(transient_time)
1344
1345            # print(transient_time, rp_target)
1346
1347        return transient_time_list

A class for parsing Thermo RAW mass spectrometry data files and instatiating MassSpectraBase or LCMSBase objects

Parameters
  • file_location (str or Path): The path to the RAW file to be parsed.
  • analyzer (str, optional): The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument. Default is "Unknown".
  • instrument_label (str, optional): The name of the instrument used to acquire the data. Default is "Unknown".
  • sample_name (str, optional): The name of the sample being analyzed. If not provided, the stem of the file_location path will be used.
Attributes
  • file_location (Path): The path to the RAW file being parsed.
  • analyzer (str): The type of mass analyzer used in the instrument.
  • instrument_label (str): The name of the instrument used to acquire the data.
  • sample_name (str): The name of the sample being analyzed.
Methods
  • run(spectra=True). Parses the RAW file and returns a dictionary of mass spectra dataframes and a scan metadata dataframe.
  • get_mass_spectrum_from_scan(scan_number, polarity, auto_process=True) Parses the RAW file and returns a MassSpecBase object from a single scan.
  • get_mass_spectra_obj(). Parses the RAW file and instantiates a MassSpectraBase object.
  • get_lcms_obj(). Parses the RAW file and instantiates an LCMSBase object.
  • get_icr_transient_times(). Return a list for transient time targets for all scans, or selected scans range

Inherits from ThermoBaseClass and SpectraParserInterface

def get_scan_df(self): 
 963    def get_scan_df(self):
 964        # This automatically brings in all the data
 965        self.chromatogram_settings.scans = (-1, -1)
 966
 967        # Get scan df info; starting with bulk ms1 and ms2 scans
 968        ms1_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(ms_type="MS", peak_detection=False, smooth=False)
 969        ms1_scan_dict = {
 970            "scan": ms1_tic_data.scans,
 971            "scan_time": ms1_tic_data.time,
 972            "tic": ms1_tic_data.tic,
 973        }
 974        ms1_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms1_scan_dict)
 975        ms1_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms1"
 976
 977        ms2_tic_data, _ = self.get_tic(
 978            ms_type="MS2", peak_detection=False, smooth=False
 979        )
 980        ms2_scan_dict = {
 981            "scan": ms2_tic_data.scans,
 982            "scan_time": ms2_tic_data.time,
 983            "tic": ms2_tic_data.tic,
 984        }
 985        ms2_tic_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(ms2_scan_dict)
 986        ms2_tic_df["ms_level"] = "ms2"
 987
 988        scan_df = (
 989            pd.concat([ms1_tic_df, ms2_tic_df], axis=0).sort_values(by="scan").reindex()
 990        )
 991
 992        # get scan text
 993        scan_filter_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(
 994            self.get_all_filters()[0], orient="index"
 995        )
 996        scan_filter_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
 997        scan_filter_df.rename(columns={"index": "scan", 0: "scan_text"}, inplace=True)
 998
 999        scan_df = scan_df.merge(scan_filter_df, on="scan", how="left")
1000        scan_df["scan_window_lower"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1001            r"\[(\d+\.\d+)-\d+\.\d+\]"
1002        )
1003        scan_df["scan_window_upper"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(
1004            r"\[\d+\.\d+-(\d+\.\d+)\]"
1005        )
1006        scan_df["polarity"] = np.where(
1007            scan_df.scan_text.str.contains(" - "), "negative", "positive"
1008        )
1009        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df.scan_text.str.extract(r"(\d+\.\d+)@")
1010        scan_df["precursor_mz"] = scan_df["precursor_mz"].astype(float)
1011        scan_df["ms_level"] = scan_df["ms_level"].str.replace("ms", "").astype(int)
1012
1013        # Assign each scan as centroid or profile
1014        scan_df["ms_format"] = None
1015        for i in scan_df.scan.to_list():
1016            if self.iRawDataPlus.IsCentroidScanFromScanNumber(i):
1017                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "centroid"
1018            else:
1019                scan_df.loc[scan_df.scan == i, "ms_format"] = "profile"
1020
1021        return scan_df

def get_ms_raw(self, spectra, scan_df): 
1023    def get_ms_raw(self, spectra, scan_df):
1024        if spectra == "all":
1025            scan_df_forspec = scan_df
1026        elif spectra == "ms1":
1027            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 1]
1028        elif spectra == "ms2":
1029            scan_df_forspec = scan_df[scan_df.ms_level == 2]
1030        else:
1031            raise ValueError("spectra must be 'none', 'all', 'ms1', or 'ms2'")
1032
1033        # Result container
1034        res = {}
1035
1036        # Row count container
1037        counter = {}
1038
1039        # Column name container
1040        cols = {}
1041
1042        # set at float32
1043        dtype = np.float32
1044
1045        # First pass: get nrows
1046        N = defaultdict(lambda: 0)
1047        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1048            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1049            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1050            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1051                i, scanStatistics
1052            )
1053            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1054            abun = np.array(abun)[np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]]
1055
1056            N[level] += len(abun)
1057
1058        # Second pass: parse
1059        for i in scan_df_forspec.scan.to_list():
1060            scanStatistics = self.iRawDataPlus.GetScanStatsForScanNumber(i)
1061            profileStream = self.iRawDataPlus.GetSegmentedScanFromScanNumber(
1062                i, scanStatistics
1063            )
1064            abun = list(profileStream.Intensities)
1065            mz = list(profileStream.Positions)
1066
1067            # Get index of abun that are > 0
1068            inx = np.where(np.array(abun) > 0)[0]
1069            mz = np.array(mz)[inx]
1070            mz = np.float32(mz)
1071            abun = np.array(abun)[inx]
1072            abun = np.float32(abun)
1073
1074            level = scan_df_forspec.loc[scan_df_forspec.scan == i, "ms_level"].values[0]
1075
1076            # Number of rows
1077            n = len(mz)
1078
1079            # No measurements
1080            if n == 0:
1081                continue
1082
1083            # Dimension check
1084            if len(mz) != len(abun):
1085                warnings.warn("m/z and intensity array dimension mismatch")
1086                continue
1087
1088            # Scan/frame info
1089            id_dict = i
1090
1091            # Columns
1092            cols[level] = ["scan", "mz", "intensity"]
1093            m = len(cols[level])
1094
1095            # Subarray init
1096            arr = np.empty((n, m), dtype=dtype)
1097            inx = 0
1098
1099            # Populate scan/frame info
1100            arr[:, inx] = i
1101            inx += 1
1102
1103            # Populate m/z
1104            arr[:, inx] = mz
1105            inx += 1
1106
1107            # Populate intensity
1108            arr[:, inx] = abun
1109            inx += 1
1110
1111            # Initialize output container
1112            if level not in res:
1113                res[level] = np.empty((N[level], m), dtype=dtype)
1114                counter[level] = 0
1115
1116            # Insert subarray
1117            res[level][counter[level] : counter[level] + n, :] = arr
1118            counter[level] += n
1119
1120        # Construct ms1 and ms2 mz dataframes
1121        for level in res.keys():
1122            res[level] = pd.DataFrame(res[level])
1123            res[level].columns = cols[level]
1124        # rename keys in res to add 'ms' prefix
1125        res = {f"ms{key}": value for key, value in res.items()}
1126
1127        return res

Instatiate a MassSpecBase object from a single scan number from the binary file, currently only supports profile mode.

Parameters
  • scan_number (int): The scan number to extract the mass spectrum from.
  • polarity (int): The polarity of the scan. 1 for positive mode, -1 for negative mode.
  • spectrum_mode (str): The type of mass spectrum to extract. Must be 'profile' or 'centroid'.
  • auto_process (bool, optional): If True, perform peak picking and noise threshold calculation after creating the mass spectrum object. Default is True.
Returns
  • MassSpecProfile | MassSpecCentroid: The MassSpecProfile or MassSpecCentroid object containing the parsed mass spectrum.

def get_lcms_obj(self, spectra='all'): 
1268    def get_lcms_obj(self, spectra="all"):
1269        """Instatiates a LCMSBase object from the mzML file.
1270
1271        Parameters
1272        ----------
1273        verbose : bool, optional
1274            If True, print progress messages. Default is True.
1275        spectra : str, optional
1276            Which mass spectra data to include in the output. Default is "all".  Other options: "none", "ms1", "ms2".
1277
1278        Returns
1279        -------
1280        LCMSBase
1281            LCMS object containing mass spectra data. The object is instatiated with the file location, analyzer, instrument, sample name, scan info, mz dataframe (as specifified), polarity, as well as the attributes holding the scans, retention times, and tics.
1282        """
1283        _, scan_df = self.run(spectra="none")  # first run it to just get scan info
1284        res, scan_df = self.run(
1285            scan_df=scan_df, spectra=spectra
1286        )  # second run to parse data
1287        lcms_obj = LCMSBase(
1288            self.file_location,
1289            self.analyzer,
1290            self.instrument_label,
1291            self.sample_name,
1292            self,
1293        )
1294        if spectra != "none":
1295            for key in res:
1296                key_int = int(key.replace("ms", ""))
1297                res[key] = res[key][res[key].intensity > 0]
1298                res[key] = (
1299                    res[key].sort_values(by=["scan", "mz"]).reset_index(drop=True)
1300                )
1301                lcms_obj._ms_unprocessed[key_int] = res[key]
1302        lcms_obj.scan_df = scan_df.set_index("scan", drop=False)
1303        # Check if polarity is mixed
1304        if len(set(scan_df.polarity)) > 1:
1305            raise ValueError("Mixed polarities detected in scan data")
1306        lcms_obj.polarity = scan_df.polarity[0]
1307        lcms_obj._scans_number_list = list(scan_df.scan)
1308        lcms_obj._retention_time_list = list(scan_df.scan_time)
1309        lcms_obj._tic_list = list(scan_df.tic)
1310
1311        return lcms_obj
